item.title: Kill Tty
item.description: Out of the gate. python -c 'import pty; pty.spawn("/bin/bash")' OR python3 -c 'import pty; pty.spawn("/bin/bash")' export PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/tmp export TERM=xterm-256color alias ll='ls -lsaht --color=auto' Keyboard Shortcut: Ctrl + Z (Background Process.) stty raw -echo ; fg ; reset stty columns 200 rows 200 Grab a valid tty. What OS are you on? Grab access to those binaries fast by exporting each environment variable. Debian/CentOS/FreeBSD Want a color terminal to easily tell apart file permissions?
